intro: Schoenus laevinux, commonly known as the narrowleaf sedgeland sedge, is a perennial grass-like plant native to southern Africa. It typically grows in wetland habitats such as marshes and swampy areas, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikelets that are characteristic of the Cyperaceae family. Its root system helps stabilize soil and prevent erosion in its natural environment. Schoenus laevinux plays an important ecological role in supporting local biodiversity and maintaining wetland ecosystems.
